results.description: Brescia's Mario Balotelli is called "arrogant" by the club's ultras group as it defends Verona fans after some racially abused the Italian.
results.shortTitle: Brescia fans call Balotelli 'arrogant'
results.title: Mario Balotelli: Brescia ultras group calls striker 'arrogant'

results.description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic is set to return to Italian side AC Milan at the end of his spell with LA Galaxy, says MLS commissioner Don Garber.
results.shortTitle: Ibrahimovic 'being recruited by Milan'
results.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: AC Milan 'recruiting' LA Galaxy striker - MLS chief

results.description: Serie A could introduce five substitutions a match, after a request was sent by the Italian Football Federation (FIGC) to football's lawmakers.
results.shortTitle: Italy wants five subs for Serie A
results.title: Serie A: Italian Football Federation requests five substitutions for league

results.description: Hellas Verona are ordered to close part of their stadium for one game following the racist abuse of Mario Balotelli.
results.shortTitle: Verona ordered to close part of stadium
results.title: Mario Balotelli: Hellas Verona punished with partial stadium closure for one game

results.description: Brescia striker Mario Balotelli criticises the "small-minded" fans who shouted racist abuse at him on Sunday.
results.shortTitle: Balotelli fury at 'small-minded' fans
results.title: Mario Balotelli: Brescia striker angry at racist abuse from 'small-minded' fans

results.description: Mario Balotelli kicks the ball into the crowd and threatens to walk off the pitch in response to racist abuse from fans during Brescia's defeat by Hellas Verona.
results.shortTitle: Balotelli threatens to walk off after abuse
results.title: Hellas Verona 2-1 Brescia: Mario Balotelli threatens to walk off pitch after racist abuse from fans

results.description: Matthijs de Ligt scores his first Juventus goal as Maurizio Sarri's side return to the top of Serie A with a hard-fought derby victory over Torino.
results.shortTitle: De Ligt winner sends Juventus top
results.title: Torino 0-1 Juventus: Matthijs de Ligt scores winner as champions return top of Serie A

results.description: Real Madrid host Real Betis & Torino take on Juventus in the best of Sunday evening's European football - follow live text commentary.
results.shortTitle: Real Madrid v Betis & Torino v Juventus
results.title: Follow live text updates from Real Madrid v Betis & Torino v Juventus

results.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores a stoppage-time penalty in dramatic Juventus win as Gianluigi Buffon makes a club-record 513th league appearance.
results.shortTitle: Juve move top with late Ronaldo winner
results.title: Juventus 2-1 Genoa: Cristiano Ronaldo scores late winner

thumbnail.altText: Cristiano Ronaldo celebrates late winner for Juventus

results.description: Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis says "buffoonery from the referee" led to coach Carlo Ancelotti and his assistant being sent off against Atalanta.
results.shortTitle: Ancelotti sent off after ref 'buffoonery'
results.title: Napoli 2-2 Atalanta: 'Buffoonery from referee led to Carlo Ancelotti being set off'

thumbnail.altText: Manager Carlo Ancelotti sent off for Napoli

results.description: Romelu Lukaku scores his seventh Serie A goal of the season as Inter Milan win at Brescia to go top of the table.
results.shortTitle: Lukaku scores as Inter beat Brescia
results.title: Romelu Lukaku scores as Inter Milan beat Brescia 2-1

results.description: Sassuolo's Francesco Magnanelli and Parma's Matteo Scozzarella are given one-match bans for blasphemy during Serie A matches.
results.shortTitle: Two Serie A players given blasphemy ban
results.title: Serie A blasphemy bans: Francesco Magnanelli & Matteo Scozzarella suspended

results.description: Franck Ribery is banned for three matches and fined 20,000 euros for pushing an assistant referee following Fiorentina's 2-1 defeat by Lazio.
results.shortTitle: Ribery banned for pushing official
results.title: Franck Ribery gets three-match ban for pushing official after Fiorentina defeat

results.description: Serie A leaders Juventus drop points for the first time since September after drawing 1-1 at Lecce.
results.shortTitle: Juventus held to draw by Lecce
results.title: Lecce 1-1 Juventus: Juve miss chance to extend Serie A lead

results.description: Former England midfielder Jack Rodwell is in Italy over a potential move to Serie A side Roma.
results.shortTitle: Rodwell in Italy over possible Roma move
results.title: Jack Rodwell in Italy over potential move to Roma

results.description: Paulo Dybala scored two quick goals to rescue Juventus in the Champions League against Lokomotiv Moscow in Turin.
results.shortTitle: Dybala double rescues Juventus in Turin
results.title: Juventus 2-1 Lokomotiv Moscow: Paulo Dybala scores two late goals in Turin

results.description: Genoa appoint former Barcelona, Inter and Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Thiago Motta as their new manager, replacing Aurelio Andreazzoli.
results.shortTitle: Motta appointed Genoa manager
results.title: Thiago Motta appointed Genoa manager after Aurelio Andreazzoli sacked

results.description: Sampdoria and England Under-21s midfielder Ronaldo Vieira was the target of monkey chants from Roma fans in their 0-0 draw in Serie A.
results.shortTitle: Roma fans racially abuse Vieira
results.title: Ronaldo Vieira: Sampdoria midfielder racially abused by Roma fans

results.description: Romelu Lukaku scores twice as Serie A title chasers Inter Milan survive a fightback to beat Sassuolo.
results.shortTitle: Lukaku scores twice in Inter Milan win
results.title: Romelu Lukaku scores twice as Inter Milan beat Sassuolo 4-3

results.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores as Juventus beat Bologna to extend their lead in Serie A.
results.shortTitle: Ronaldo scores as Juventus win
results.title: Juventus 2-1 Bologna: Ronaldo goal helps Juventus extend Serie A lead
